requisitos: Build and lead a centralized QA team focused on driving platform-wide quality practices and capabilities.
Redefine and monitor key quality KPIs, including, but not limited to Change Failure Rate (CFR), Escaped Defect Rate, and Deployment Validation Time.
Own, maintain and develop our E2E test case management tools.
Design, develop, and maintain custom test frameworks, reusable tooling, and test automation pipelines.
Influence cross-team quality practices by driving adoption of shared tools, code standards, and documentation.
Support incident reviews and reliability assessments with a quality-first mindset.
Influence a culture of accountability, observability, and resilience through test coverage and continuous verification.
Recruit, manage, mentor and inspire a high-impact QA Team.
Stay ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies to ensure our QA practices remain cutting-edge.
5+ years of experience in Quality Assurance or Software Engineering roles, with at least 2 in a technical or people leadership position.
Strong background in testing distributed systems, cloud-native applications, or platform tools.
Proficiency with automated testing frameworks on multiple languages (e.g., Python, Java, Go, or similar).
Experience integrating quality into DevOps and SRE practices (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab, Prometheus, Grafana, Alerts).
Metrics-driven mindset – measure before build.
Strong communication and collaboration skills – you’ll influence and support engineers across multiple verticals, including the development of your teammates.
Comfortable working in fast-paced, globally distributed environments.
Fluent English is a must.
Cloud experience, especially AWS and EKS (Kubernetes) based workloads.
Performance monitoring experience, particularly in large-scale distributed environments.

Technical Roadmap: co-create the product backlog with the engineering team, prioritize features, and write clear and concise product specifications.

Leverage AI: Actively use AI tools in your day-to-day work to improve your own productivity and to better understand the needs of your users.

Spanish is desirable
Experience being a technical PM OR Developer background
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).

titulo: Senior Software Engineer, Technical Referent - Cloud Platform
requisitos: Framework Ownership: Set the technical vision for our internal application framework stack, defining conventions, project archetypes, and lifecycle management for libraries and tooling.
Platform Engineering: Design, build, and maintain core platform components (SDKs, shared services, CI/CD pipelines) in Golang and Java, enabling product teams to ship quality code quickly and safely.

Architecture & Standards: Champion best practices in microservice design, domain-driven design, clean architecture, and twelve-factor principles; review and approve RFCs that impact how we deploy code company-wide.
DevEx Enablement: Create self-service developer actions, golden-path templates, and automated guardrails (linting, static analysis, vulnerability scanning) to streamline the developer experience.
Cloud & IaC Expertise: Provision and manage AWS resources with Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform/CDK), implement GitOps workflows, and drive adoption of Kubernetes-native patterns (Helm, Argo CD).
Reliability Engineering: Embed observability (metrics, traces, logs) by default; standardize SLIs/SLOs and incident-management playbooks across services.
Security by Design: Integrate secure-coding guidelines, secrets-management, least-privilege IAM, SBOM generation, and supply-chain-security checks into the SDLC.
Mentorship & Leadership: Serve as technical referent for a multi-disciplinary platform team; coach engineers, run architecture reviews, and foster a culture of continuous improvement.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner closely with Security, and Infrastructure teams to align roadmaps, manage technical debt, and ensure platform capabilities meet business needs.
Continuous Improvement: Track industry trends, evaluate new technologies (service mesh, eBPF, WASM, etc.), and pilot innovations that keep our platform ahead of scale and compliance demands.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
5+ years of professional experience building large-scale backend or platform systems, with deep proficiency in Golang and Java.
Proven track record designing and operating cloud-native architectures on AWS (EKS, ECS/Fargate, Lambda, API Gateway, RDS, DynamoDB, etc.).
Hands-on mastery of containerization & orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes), Infra-as-Code (Terraform/CDK), and modern CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, Argo CD).
Strong knowledge of microservices, event-driven architectures (Kafka, SNS/SQS), and REST/gRPC API design.
Experience creating reusable SDKs, libraries, or internal developer platforms.
Solid grasp of software-security fundamentals: OWASP, IAM, secrets management, dependency-scanning, SBOMs.
Familiarity with observability stacks (Prometheus, Grafana, OpenTelemetry) and performance-profiling tools.
Good communication skills in English; able to articulate complex ideas to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Thorough understanding of agile methodologies, trunk-based development, and continuous delivery principles.

Optimize Product Development Workflows: Design, implement, and continuously improve streamlined product development processes and methodologies, specifically adapting them to the unique requirements and ways of working of dLocal. Focus on clarity, efficiency, and scalability for product teams.

Tools Configuration & Enhancement: collaborate in the selection, configuration, and optimization of our product management, project tracking, and analytics tool stack. This includes identifying opportunities to leverage AI-enhanced features within these tools to automate routine tasks, provide richer insights, and make them more useful for Product Managers.

Streamline Planning & Progress Tracking: define, maintain, and evolve our playbook for product planning, roadmap management, and real-time progress tracking that provide clear visibility to Product Managers, engineering, and leadership, empowered by automation and AI, reducing the teams time investment without sacrificing visibility.

Boost Product Manager Efficiency: Proactively identify and resolve operational bottlenecks that hinder Product Manager productivity. This includes defining best practices for documentation, data collection, templates, and above all usage of AI Tools that simplify common PM tasks.

Continuously improve the process of Cross-Functional Alignment: Enhance communication and collaboration channels between Product Development teams, Stakeholders, leaders, and the organization in general. Ensure teams align on product goals, ways of working, and provide 360 visibility.

Knowledge Management & Enablement: Develop and maintain a centralized repository of product operations best practices, playbooks, and training materials. Ensure effective adoption of new processes and tools.

Performance Analysis & Improvement: Define and track key operational metrics related to product development cycle times, resource utilization, and process adherence. Analyze data to identify areas for continuous improvement and report on the overall health and efficiency of the product organization.
5+ years of dedicated experience in a Product Operations, or similar operational role within a dynamic technology or fintech environment.
Demonstrable experience in designing, implementing, and optimizing product development processes and workflows that have led to measurable gains in efficiency and productivity.
Strong expertise in configuring, customizing, and integrating various product management, project tracking, and analytics tools.
Proven ability to leverage automation and AI-enhanced tooling to streamline operations and empower users.
Exceptional organizational skills, with attention to details and the ability to manage multiple complex initiatives simultaneously.

Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with a proven ability to influence and collaborate effectively with diverse technical and non-technical stakeholders across all levels of the organization.
A proactive, problem-solving mindset with a passion for continuous improvement and driving operational excellence.
Fluency in English is essential. Proficiency in Spanish or Portuguese is a strong asset due to our global presence.

Own OpenTelemetry Pipelines: Design, implement, and maintain observability pipelines across the three main signals—logs, metrics, and traces—ensuring standardized, scalable, and efficient data ingestion. Optimize ingestion strategies to balance cost, performance, and usability.

Empower Engineering Teams: Build self-service automation and tooling that enables development teams to instrument and leverage observability without requiring manual intervention from the SRE team. Drive adoption of best practices while ensuring teams own their telemetry.

Support Incident Management: Be the Engineering side of our Incident Management Team, designing the processes, playbooks, checklists, and automations for them and other engineers to follow during an incident.

Collaborate Across Teams: Interact with members from almost all teams across the business to understand their monitoring, alerting and SLO / SLA requirements and design systems and processes that ensure we meet or exceed these requirements. Influence architectural decisions during initial design stages to ensure resiliency and scale at the outset of software development.
Automate Observability Infrastructure: Leverage Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) to provision and manage monitoring tools, alerting rules, and our observability configurations across OTEL Pipelines.

Define Baseline Observability Standards: Design base level requirements for new and existing services to ensure that all dLocal infrastructure and code are monitored consistently and accurately at a basic level.
Own Technical and Security Health: Take full ownership of dLocal’s infrastructure reliability, ensuring adherence to key availability and security KPIs.
Optimize Alerting Systems: Continuously refine alerting signals to minimize noise and ensure them are always actionable, reducing fatigue and improving response efficiency.

Data Strategy and Leadership: Develop and implement a comprehensive data strategy that supports overall business objectives and ensures alignment with company goals. Champion the strategic vision for data usage and analytics, promoting adoption and understanding across all levels of the organization.

Strategic Data Architecture Oversight: Guide and oversee the design and optimization of robust, scalable data architecture, ensuring data availability, integrity, and security. AI-Driven Data Analytics and Insights: Integrate AI and machine learning models into analytics solutions to enhance predictive capabilities and deliver actionable insights. Leverage AI-driven tools to automate data processing, improve decision-making, and identify emerging trends and opportunities. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure AI models align with business objectives and demonstrate measurable impact.

Business-Driven Data Analytics: Lead the creation and continuous improvement of analytics solutions to deliver actionable insights to stakeholders. Work closely with business, especially Product teams, to identify and prioritize data-driven opportunities and effectively demonstrate measurable business impact.

Executive Stakeholder Management: Regularly engage with senior management, including C-Level and Heads of Product, to present strategic insights, report on initiative progress, and showcase clear impacts on the business. Effectively manage expectations and articulate the strategic value delivered by data initiatives.

Vendor and Cost Management: Evaluate and manage vendor relationships, ensuring efficient use of external partnerships. Oversee and optimize data infrastructure costs, focusing on cloud services efficiency in collaboration with Platform leadership.

Data Governance, Security, and Compliance: Develop and enforce robust data governance frameworks to maintain data quality, compliance, and security. Collaborate closely with InfoSec to ensure data security standards and compliance with privacy regulations are consistently upheld.
